sense.name: move or execute very quickly or hastily
sense.examples: She dashed across the road. Down upon the Austrian ranks dashed the Hussars, straight as an arrow to its mark. He apparently dashed off the email without thinking about the consequences. Ashley dashed down a list of the ingredients and passed it to Brittany on her way out.

sense.name: break by or as if by hurling or thrusting violently
sense.examples: The waves dashed against the rocks. Thor drew in all his godlike strength and dashed the cup with a terrific effort at Hymer, breaking it into a thousand pieces. Hopes for a weight loss drug were dashed by its failure in human trials. Infertility dashed the dreams of fatherhood for this Indianapolis teacher.

sense.name: add an enlivening or contrasting element to
sense.examples: The blue paint was dashed with white. He often dashed his sketches with a little humor. Try this sinful salmon chowder dashed with cognac.
